On a more positive note, gay men are cool because that means more women for the rest of us, and gay women are cool because they have better tastes than straight women.

So, uhm... I tried the 2nd pinguin link because I could log in as a guest.
It seems it really is a chat programme, not so much a game, although either I missed something, or the guest account disallows you from actualling chatting. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
The little extras are fun though (I'm used to chats like this to only let you move around on the screen, enter different rooms), but penguins just don't do it for me.
Somebody should do something like this in the Keen universe instead, allowing different enemies to spar a little bit while chatting... or something...

title: Re: School:
content:
I'm going to pause my sarcasm for a second just to quiet the blatant ignorance.

[quote]Quote:[hr]In kindergarten, you'll have the story about the prince who wants to find true happines, and marries another prince.[hr][/quote]
Fifty years ago people like you were complaining that children had to read stories about black people in kindergarten.

[quote]Quote:[hr]I'm sorry, but gay is just wrong; why do people become gay anyway?[hr][/quote]
Try reading the science section of a news magazine occasionally. Study after study has shown that sexuality is biologically predetermined by birth.

[quote]Quote:[hr]I just don't beleive that gay people, whose relationships produce nothing, should be rewarded the same as a family of 7, who's parents work at the wheel, just trying to make by[hr][/quote]
And a married couple that has decided not to have children is a much more valuble relationship, clearly. A relationship's value should be based on the partners' devotion to each other, not the number offspring and how hard the parents work.

It is not uncommon that a gay couple will adopt a child and give that child the oppurtunity of a loving family to grow up in that the child did not previously had. Two gay parents is a far better environment for a child then a single mother, which is far too prevalent in this day and age.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Who knows, one of those kids could find the cure for AIDS, or Cancer.[hr][/quote]
Who knows, one of those kids could rape your sister or murder your brother. WTF did this last sentence have to do with anything?[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: School:
content:
"I'm sorry, but gay is just wrong; why do people become gay anyway?"
I guess most don't choose it, they just notice it later. Or how do I know.. I guess they want marriage as much as you do.. Besides, gay couples can adobt or have someone to birth them a baby, although I don't support that kind of families at all.

At least so far I've heard about homosexuality in school only couple of times, if even that. I'm pretty sure there's no subliminal messaging to encourage in it (here). I'd guess it would be other way around here, Finland's population growth is really low.

Anyways, as I've probably made clear, I'm not defending gays, this whole matter doesn't concern me at all since I don't even know anyone who is one.[url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: Err...
content:
"I do not support contraception, abortion, and Euthanasia."

So, at the risk of bringing the tone down even further, if somebody raped your sister and she got pregnant, you'd force her to go through with the pregnancy and become a single mother of some criminal's child, just to prove a point?

"The impression I get is that you're about my age (13, nearly 14) - you really should be more mature than you are acting."

I saw a rather interesting segment in a science show on TV a couple of weeks ago about the development of the human brain. Not surprisingly about this age or a little younger is when the brain has finally developed an understanding of the world around it, and because it has only just grasped it, it rebels against anything different. This explains why Najawa feels so strongly against the concept of homosexuality - it goes against everything he's been taught up to this point in his life, and at this stage of mental development the only way the brain can cope is to reject the concept.

It's not until the brain has developed further that it can cope with these concepts. That's why it was the youngest members of this forum posting the "eww gay" messages and the older members saying "you should be more tolerant" - tolerance only comes once the brain has developed further, often referred to as "maturity."

So there's no point trying to prove there's nothing wrong with being gay, it'll happen eventually once the brain has reached a certain stage of development. Unless of course it's fed intolerant information by those around it, but that's another issue altogether...

Surprisingly enough, according to this story the brain doesn't fully develop until the age of 25 (!) which would explain why there are still immature people around in their early 20's, but very few immature 30 year olds. Luckily it's a lot sooner than this for most of us... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Err...

[quote]Quote:[hr]I'm sorry, but gay is just wrong; why do people become gay anyway? Why do they need a marraige anyway? The only thing a gay 'marriage' does, is gives them a tax deduction. The reason married people get this right-off, is becasue married people bring children into this world, and the children are our future. Gay is just greedy, selfishness. If you want to kiss someone of the same gender, go ahead; I can't stop you. I just don't beleive that gay people, whose relationships produce nothing, should be rewarded the same as a family of 7, who's parents work at the wheel, just trying to make by, and give this world 5 hard working children who could change this world. Who knows, one of those kids could find the cure for AIDS, or Cancer.[hr][/quote]

Dude you're even more stupid than I thought you were. Age is no excuse in your case. -----------------

title: Turning?
content:
This topic is becoming quite amusing.

[hr]Najawa I no case do I see gay to be nuteral
[hr]I find that a rather entertaining typo.

[hr]Najawa In kindergarten, you'll have the story about the prince who wants to find true happines, and marries another prince. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img]
Retodon Najawa, where can I find the story of the 2 princes?
[hr]*searches* Apparently it's entitled [url=http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1582460612/002-9826149-8472811?v=glance]King & King[/url]. There also seems to be a sequel of sorts called [url=http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1582461139/ref=pd_sim_b_1/002-9826149-8472811?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance]King & King & Family[/url].

[hr]Najawa If there are multiple truths, which one it true ...?
[hr]So, you're saying either you're wrong or everyone who disagrees with you is wrong, but you don't know which is the case?

[hr]Najawa (Don't you see the irony?)
[hr]You're badmouthing irony now? Believe me, that's one concept you don't want to make an enemy of...

[hr]Najawa Gay is just greedy, selfishness.
[hr]Yes, I'm sure homo/bi/etcsexuals enjoy going out of their way to make life difficult for themselves by choosing to be what they are in the face of a society that seems to hold them in contempt (and most of nature, for that matter). What assholes for hogging up all the hatred.

I'll tell you what's greedy: a man and a woman marry, have four kids, get divorced and start arguing over who gets the kids, just for the sake of money and ego, refusing to look squarely at what scenario might be most beneficial to the kids.

[hr]Najawa The only thing a gay 'marriage' does, is gives them a tax deduction.
[hr]While some may abuse the system, which is also the case with 'normal' marriage, it's basically a means of attaining official recognition. (IMKO, legal recognition of anything is useless and way overrated, but each to his/her own).

~o~

I know several people who have varying shades of sexuality. For starters, my girlfriend is bisexual, as is one of my best friends' girlfriend. There's a gay guy who left town some time ago who used to hang out and party and a friend of Mum's who is a transexual (which does not necessarily equate to homosexual, and indeed does not in this case).

They're all classy, as far as people in general go, far better people than some of the fucling mainstream jackasses that call themselves normal. I don't understand what all the fuss is about, really.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[quote]Quote:[hr]I do however like the report that an english teacher [in england, where else] refused to teach romeo and juliet because it was 'balantly heterosexual'[hr][/quote]

I can relate. I starred and edited a film for a visual arts project last year at my [scoff]"conservative"[/scoff] private school in which we made a Pop/American/Australian Idol knock-off in which i played a gay judge. The school feared that further exposure to the film would destroy the school's reputation. Ppft, what reputation? I was just sitting there cracking inoffensive gay jokes. What the hell's the big deal?

Oh, and OH MY GOD, our school refused to teach 'Romeo and Juliet' as some teachers at our school thought it promotes rebellion and hardcore sex. What sex? Have they bothered to read the book? For heavens sake, they'll offer us sex education classes but they won't let us study the "intimate details" of Romeo and Juliet's short-lived sequence of events?

[quote]Quote:[hr]Geez, I may seem immature to you; but I know what I'm talking about; I've studied it.[hr][/quote]

You are immature, and you have no idea what the hell you're talking about. Believe me, sooner or later you'll hit yourself in the head and ask yourself "what the hell was I thinking?"

Believe me, I was in your shoes, except I don't believe i were ever arrogant and/or irrational. As of now, as far as i'm concerned, i've never posted 106 posts spanning across three days, i've never released a mod, nor have I made a really sh*t movie called 'Bloogville'. What the hell was I thinking? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

Bullskit. While there [usually] is only one thing that is true, our 'truth' is always an interpretation of data. For example we know gas are out there, thats the truth. But what opinion should that give us?

[quote]Quote:[hr]You are immature, and you have no idea what the hell you're talking about. Believe me, sooner or later you'll hit yourself in the head and ask yourself "what the hell was I thinking?"[hr][/quote]

I starred and edited a film for a visual arts project last year at my [scoff]"conservative"[/scoff] private school in which we made a Pop/American/Australian Idol knock-off in which i played a gay judge. The school feared that further exposure to the film would destroy the school's reputation. Ppft, what reputation? I was just sitting there cracking inoffensive gay jokes. I call this misovercompensation; an institute or person cannot prevent a big problem, so they try extra hard to destroy a minor one. In my country its called 'Political corectness'

[quote]Quote:[hr]Remember the holocaust, slaves, etc. when people thought your way?[hr][/quote]

I believe these were caused more by Us and Them mentality rather than 'being jewish is wrong' and such. Even today we do it, and feel good about it. Think about it, would you listen attentively to a person like Najawa? to try and find what point they're making, or would you dismiss it as total crap. I try to do this, and believe me, it can be difficult.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Study after study has shown that sexuality is biologically predetermined by birth.[hr][/quote]

Not quite; its usually predispositioned by birth, and recent evidence suggests that while in men biological factors dictate sexuality, women are mainly socialy modled. Remember the old saying? Homosexuality isn't hereditary? Heh.

What's wrong with having it off topic? :P I love these debates.

It seems pretty clear to me that najawa has been raised in an ultraconservative and probably Catholic ("life from conception to natural death" I always hear quoted by Catholics) family, and he's just repeating the various values he's been indoctrinated with all his life.

najawa- editing out your arguments because a lot of people disagreed with them is really lame.

And now, to put another spin on this topic :P

[quote]Quote:[hr]So, at the risk of bringing the tone down even further, if somebody raped your sister and she got pregnant, you'd force her to go through with the pregnancy and become a single mother of some criminal's child, just to prove a point?[hr][/quote]
Rape is indeed the worst crime someone can commit. There is no possible reason for someone to rape. And when your sister gets pregnant after someone raping her, that does suck quite a bit.
I would be against abortion in that situation, but not to prove a point. I strongly believe that no matter the source, human life is something people should protect at all costs, and whether or not you consider a fetus very humanoid, it is alive and it is going to be a newborn baby in a few months that I doubt you would be so fine with killing.

If your sister can't take care of the baby, we've got the perfect solution - let two gay parents adopt it :P[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Why argue about that?
content:
[hr]Najawa 1) The sky is Blue

[hr]Najawa 3) Keen is the best game ever made
[hr]There are seven of them. If you include all the fangames and mods, that makes alot more, and the vast majority of these are far from the best games ever made...

[hr]Najawa 4) Only women can carry babies during a pregnancy (Try to argue that!!!)
[hr]What about female goats? Female elephants?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

I find it strange you didn't say 'only females can become pregnant'... that would've been hard to argue against, but 'carry babies' and 'during a pregnancy? There's always a pregnancy somewhere in the world, and as long as you have arms it's possible to carry a baby...

Interesting 'truths'... still yet to hear an irrefutable one.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

title: Re: Why argue about that?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I blame the church for making our society still resemble the middle ages, not to mention our attitude towards sex.[hr][/quote]

Yes, just look at how progressive Islamic countries are. And india, no churches there!

Quite frankly, people are azzholes, and the azzholes in any society screw it up for the rest of us. [And by the law of averages there are plenty of gay azzholes too, I happen to know one.]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Our forum is a nice example of how people behave everywhere. A topic about gayness and sex, and the forum is full of life[hr][/quote]

Jeez, its only sex fer chrissake. I imagine that it has to be so damn pleasant otherwise no one in their right mind would ever engage in it. I mean, when you really think about what it involves... ewwwww.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Rape is indeed the worst crime someone can commit. There is no possible reason for someone to rape. And when your sister gets pregnant after someone raping her, that does suck quite a bit.[hr][/quote]

Rape, like many things has its grey areas. Just what is unconsensual? What if no sexual act takes place, but a sexual situation exists. And as for a reason, there are dozens of reasons to rape, the primary one being it feels damn pleasant. [It may totally ruin someones life, but there are plaenty of people who only care about what makes them feel good right now, after all, have you ever stolen anything? Its like that just a lot worse.]

[quote]Quote:[hr]2) I am a boy (Thank God!!!)[hr][/quote]

Are you sure? You could always have to X and 1 Y chroesomes; or 4X, 6X even. Or 2Y then there are the interesting cases of males who continue to develop the female [default] body plan after birth. [Most men develop nipples for example, in about 4% of cases they're functional, and in a small number of cases breast development occurs- I have a friend who took hormone therapy to prevent this.]

Also, several million of your mothers cells have migrated into your body through the placenta, where they remain to this day. It is even possible you have a few of your grandmothers lying around. [Conversely your mother has the cells of all her children in her; being younger they tend to spread around a bit.]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Interesting 'truths'... still yet to hear an irrefutable one.[hr][/quote]

The charge on an electron is exactly equal, but opposite to that on a proton.

title: Re: Err...
content:
Najawa: "I agree with Xtra: Adoption would be the best option, though, I don't think it'd be to a gay couple; if they want children, think straight."

You seem to be under the impression that being gay is a choice that people make - it's not, people are born gay and they can't change. It's really a medical condition - explained simply, when a baby is conceived it receives certain cells that decide whether it will be a boy or a girl. Sometimes this doesn't work the way it should, and the baby receives a little of each, and thus you may have a boy who has also received some of the 'girl' cells - which is the cause of being gay. That's why gay men are interested in things that are traditionally female - fashion being the most obvious.

That's why you can't just decide not to be gay, any more than you can decide you don't like the colour of your eyes. You're born like that, and there's nothing you or anyone else can do about it.

title: Re: Err...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Sometimes this doesn't work the way it should, and the baby receives a little of each, and thus you may have a boy who has also received some of the 'girl' cells - which is the cause of being gay.[hr][/quote]
Are you sure? I heard it was improper hormone dosage during pregnancy to the baby, often caused by stress related issues. Do you have a source, out of curiosity?[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Err...
content:
Oh it could be, I just remember hearing years ago that it was something to do with receiving too many chromosomes or not enough or the wrong combination etc. But that was a good few years ago, I wouldn't be surprised if they've changed their minds by now.

If it was caused by improper hormone dosage you'd think it'd be pretty sensitive though - surely if something like stress was enough to trigger it you'd see a lot more gay people than you do now...

title: Re: Err...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]explained simply, when a baby is conceived it receives certain cells that decide whether it will be a boy or a girl. Sometimes this doesn't work the way it should, and the baby receives a little of each, and thus you may have a boy who has also received some of the 'girl' cells - which is the cause of being gay. That's why gay men are interested in things that are traditionally female - fashion being the most obvious.[hr][/quote]

This is somewhat simplified. Homosexuality in males appears to be more dictated by 'brain wiring'; if your brain is wired up the 'wrong' way, you're gay.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Are you sure? I heard it was improper hormone dosage during pregnancy to the baby, often caused by stress related issues. Do you have a source, out of curiosity?[hr][/quote]

This has been discredited by hormone studies in men and women. There are a surprising number of testosterone rich women and estrogen rich men living out there, and only a slight correlation with homosexuality exists. Interestingly, if you get a lot of testosterone in the womb, you''l have lots of sons. Plenty of estrogen? Then daughters for you. [Also, there is mounting evidence that the more 'even' your middle and ring fingers, the more femminine you are. Research continues] Source, New Scientist. See also: [url=http://www.news-medical.net/?id=8167]www.news-medical.net/?id=8167[/url]

[quote]Quote:[hr]That's why you can't just decide not to be gay, any more than you can decide you don't like the colour of your eyes. You're born like that, and there's nothing you or anyone else can do about it.[hr][/quote]

On the contrary, with a course of therapy there is a pretty good 'cure' rate for homosexuality.A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: Err...
content:
Perhaps you didn't RTFA? Because it says, "The reality is that homosexuality is not an illness. It does not require treatment and is not changeable." So I'm not sure why you would describe the "cure" rate as pretty good. Seeing as how it seems to be a 0% rate. Unless you have better data than the APA, of course.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: Err...
content:
*sigh*

Wether or not something is an ilness is debateable, there is a [thankfully small] deaf community who wish to declassify deafness as a disability and are calling for the deaf to avoid operations that might 'cure' them.

The cure rate for homosexuality, contrary to propoganda does actually exist. It is actually possible to change sexual orientation through therapy, just is it is possible [and indeed much easier] to fabricate memories of rape and child abuse.

Of course we aren't talking 10% here, often not even 1% and even then 'partial cures' of varying degrees and relapses are rife. Nevertheless, there is a 'cure' rate.
